message: If my topic's title is a single Hebrew word, it works fine (ex: "בדיקה"). But if my title has more than one word, meaning it contains a space, then I get a "page not found" error page (ex: "נושא חדש").
@zerok Well if you're right, it sucks :) I want my group member to be able to communicate in Hebrew only.

Could this perhaps have something to do with the slugify-implementation of the title? For instance if I create a topic with the German umlauts "äß" it would get slugified as "a". So there seems to be no replacement for "ß" and I can only imagine there are simply no replacements yet for a lot of other characters :-)
oh man, I used to QA Movable Type, and I remember so many bugs that happened with non-english characters and creating permalinks... it was a total snakepit
there was a bug with a topic with only "1" too, so I assume that's related

From own painful experice on a project, I can definitely recommend dealing with transliteration of non-ascii characters asap. I don't know about python, but for ruby there's a port of the perl unidecode library that handles transliterations from every charater set very well.
